text: Georg Michaelis (8 September 1857 – 24 July 24 1936) became the first Chancellor of Germany with a non-noble background. ==Early life== Michaelis was born at Haynau in Silesia. He studied law in Breslau, Leipzig and Wurzburg. He graduated from Göttingen University in 1884."Georg Michaelis" at Archontology.org; retrieved 2013-4-4. ==Career== He was invited by the Japanese government to teach at the German school of law in Tokyo from 1885 to 1889. When he returned to Germany, he joined the civil service. The Emperor appointed him Reich Chancellor (Reichskanzler) from July to November 1917. ==Related pages== * Foreign advisors to the government in Meiji period Japan ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1857 births Category:1936 deaths Category:Chancellors of the German Empire Category:Foreign advisors to the government in Meiji-period Japan Category:German people of World War I Category:Ministers-President of Prussia Category:People from former German territories
title: Georg Michaelis
